CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PIDT-C12NT - This is a polymer material used as the donor in the bulk heterojunction solar cells.
2. PC71BM - This is another polymer material used as the acceptor in the bulk heterojunction solar cells.

So, the two "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. PIDT-C12NT
2. PC71BM

These are the only two entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Best performance of the bulk - heterojunction solar cells with a power conversion efficiency of 5.05% was achieved with PIDT-C12NT as donor and (6,6)-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as acceptor , which can be attributed to its higher charge carrier mobility , the optimized interpenetrating network as well as enhanced absorption coefficient of photoactive layer with respect to the other two polymers.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph:

1. Power conversion efficiency: This is a numerical value that represents the efficiency of the solar cells in converting sunlight into electrical energy. It is mentioned as 5.05%.
2. PIDT-C12NT: This is a specific type of donor polymer used in the solar cells. It is identified by its chemical name, which includes the abbreviation "PIDT" and the number "C12NT".
3. PC71BM: This is another specific type of acceptor polymer used in the solar cells. It is identified by its chemical name, which includes the abbreviation "PC71BM".
4. Charge carrier mobility: This is a numerical value that represents the speed at which charge carriers (such as electrons and holes) move through the photoactive layer of the solar cells. It is mentioned as higher for PIDT-C12NT.
5. Optimized interpenetrating network: This is a term that refers to the structure of the photoactive layer in the solar cells, which is optimized to maximize the efficiency of the solar cells.
6. Absorption coefficient: This is a numerical value that represents the ability of the photoactive layer to absorb light. It is mentioned as higher for PIDT-C12NT compared to the other two polymers.

So, the "Property Value" entities in the given paragraph are:

* Power conversion efficiency (5.05%)
* PIDT-C12NT
* PC71BM
* Charge carrier mobility
* Optimized interpenetrating network
* Absorption coefficient
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties:

1. Power conversion efficiency (5.05%) - This is the value of the material property that represents the efficiency of the solar cells in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
2. Charge carrier mobility - This is the value of the material property that represents the speed at which charge carriers (such as electrons and holes) move through the photoactive layer of the solar cells.
3. Absorption coefficient - This is the value of the material property that represents the ability of the photoactive layer to absorb light.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities from the paragraph that refer to the value of material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 5.05% |
| high |
| high |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
